result.execSummary:
The defendant James Thomas Bean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Thomas Bean

records.addlTxt:
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. 
Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 


SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements made by all parties. COURT ORDERED:
 Defendant to serve 65 DAYS the House of Correction  with  5 days of pretrial incarceration credit  
 Huber for  employment  and Childcare.           Report Date: 11-9-2022 by 5:00pm.

Pay mandatory Costs, fees and surcharges. Payable in 18  Months or Civil Judgment.
Provide DNA specimen and pay related surcharge. 
Appellate Rights Given. 


AS TO COUNT2 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant James Thomas Bean in court.  
Attorney Justin Padway in court for James Thomas Bean.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for an Arraignment. 
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS  Report received and filed.

Defendant James T Bean in court with attorney Justin Padway . Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney William R. F. Ackell for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling Confernce. Defendant also case 22TR12158. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 11:00 am. 
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-6-2022
Received and filed

02:44 PM Defendant James Thomas Bean in court with Attorney Justin Padway.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Sheriff Detective. B. Conte. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-25-2022, Filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant James Thomas Bean in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant James Thomas Bean in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Thomas Bean appeared by video means with Attorney.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
